Description: Upper body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of figure holding a mastos-shaped vessel, reclining on couch with two pillows with much added red.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.12)
Payne 1931 / Necrocorinthia. A study of corinthian art in the archaic period (p. 318, no. 1191)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 220, no. 49)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.038) (Phase 1)
